question: Associate the correct definition to the correct component in the GSM architecture

list: Includes all control and signalling functions for managing calls and mobility
The user's mobile device. It includes a Terminal Equipment (TE) and a Subscriber Identity Module (SIM) card
Implements higher layers protocols and manages all transmission resources of the connected BTSs
Manages physical layer connections with the UEs and the BSC
Connects the mobile network to the external telephone networks. It implements all signalling interworking functions

answer.Mobile Switching Centre: Includes all control and signalling functions for managing calls and mobility
answer.User Equipment: The user's mobile device. It includes a Terminal Equipment (TE) and a Subscriber Identity Module (SIM) card
answer.Base Station Controller: Implements higher layers protocols and manages all transmission resources of the connected BTSs
answer.Base Transceiver Station: Manages physical layer connections with the UEs and the BSC
answer.Gateway MSC: Connects the mobile network to the external telephone networks. It implements all signalling interworking functions

question: What are the advantages and disadvantages of having small or larger cells in mobile networks?
options: Small cells are more expensive to deploy and maintain compared to larger cells, which are cheaper and more energy-efficient.
None of the other options.
Small cells are only suitable for urban areas, while larger cells can only be used in rural areas.
Small cells reduce interference and improve signal quality, whereas larger cells are prone to higher levels of interference and degraded signal quality.

Small cells provide higher capacity and better coverage in dense areas but may require more frequent handovers as users move, while larger cells cover wider areas with fewer handovers but might have lower capacity in dense environments.
